result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Allen Lindquist #247755 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:44  This includes 15CF170  Defendant Steven Allen Lindquist in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant Steven Allen Lindquist in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie files amended information on each case.  Probation 2 yrs concurrent to each other and conc to confinement and ES in MN now on.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the charges in the amended complaints in 15CF169  Poss of Meth   and 15CF170   Poss of Meth   Facts are correct   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the amended charges in 15CF169 and 15CF170  Poss of Meth in both cases. Court orders on both cases  15CF169 and 15CF170  S/W Probation 2 years on each case conc to each other and to the confinement and ES now serving in MN.  Conditions - Court costs   on each case. DNA sample and Surcharge on 15CF169 only

Information Filed with the Court on both cases and a copy is given to the defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea in 15CF169 to Counts 1, 2 and 3 and enters not guilty plea in 15CF170 at preliminary hearing.    Not guilty plea received by the court.    The bond will continue as ordered.  Status conference to be set.

3:04 p.m. Defendant Steven Allen Lindquist in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant Steven Allen Lindquist in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 15CF170.  Thorie - proceeds with 15CF170.  Thorie calls Investigator Marty Shepler.  Shepler is sworn and takes the stand.  Thorie examines Shepler.  Shepler identifies the defendant.  Bub cross examines Shepler.  No redirect by Thorie.  Witness may be excused.  Thorie proceeds with 15CF169 - Thorie calls Sargeant Darren Ekholm.  Ekholm is sworn and takes the stand Thorie examines Ekholm.  Ekholm identifies defendant.  Bub cross examines Ekholm.  No redirect by Thorie.  Thorie gives argument in both cases.  Bub gives argument in both cases.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings in both cases.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

3:50 p.m.  Defendant Steven Allen Lindquist in court via videoconferencing with attorney Christopher R. Bub via phone.  Defendant Steven Allen Lindquist in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 15CF170.    Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and maximum penalties.    Defendant waives reading of the complaint.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Thorie requesting $1,000.00 cash bond on each case.  Bub has no objections.  No waiver of time limit for preliminary hearing.  Lindquist will waive time limits for preliminary hearing.  Warrants to be quashed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
